article.headline: Western Carolina 57, North Carolina Greensboro 54
article.story: CULLOWHEE, N.C. (AP) -- Nick Aldridge scored 15 points and Western Carolina rallied from a 12-point second-half deficit to defeat UNC Greensboro 57-54 on Saturday. Antonio Russell added 14 points for the Catamounts (6-9, 3-1), who shot 60 percent from the line and snapped a five-game losing streak. Junior Kyle Hines set the UNC Greensboro career record for double-doubles with 28 by scoring 13 points and grabbing 12 rebounds for the Spartans (6-8, 3-2), who also shot 60 percent from the line. Kendall Toney led the Spartans with 15 points. UNC Greensboro led 24-20 at the half. The Spartans went on a 10-0 run early in the second half with Hines scoring five of those points to push their lead to 34-22. Western Carolina rallied and Jake Robinson hit a 3-pointer with 6:42 left to bring the Catamounts within two at 44-42. The lead switched several times in the final minutes. Kyle Greathouse hit two free throws with 6.5 seconds left to give Western Carolina a 57-54 lead. Ricky Hickman missed a three-pointer as time ran out and the Spartans lost their second straight.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
